Detailed Description

ParNetwork class definition.

Based on Network and other mechanisms in Neuron to handle a collection groups of neurons, create them from a configuration file, the outputs, etc. in a parallel environment

void ParNetwork::build_from_file ( std::string  configfilename,
std::string  logfilename = "log.dat",
bool  no_output = false 
)

connect to another group according to a script file describing the connections

this function is quite awful, but most of the object construction using the script file has been encapsulated in class constructors, so that only the overall process with the main tags are read here almost all the parameters are not known in this scope TODO: This needs to be split into a configurator and an implementor, so one process does not decide to build everything all at once

void ParNetwork::update (  )  [inline]

Update method, all the groups are updated from #0 to last one

void ParNetwork::config_from_file ( std::string  configfilename,
Size &  ncells,
Size &  ngroups,
std::string  logfilename = "log.dat",
bool  no_output = false 
)

Setup SpikeSim network from script.txt.

Load in the appropriate parameters from a script file but do NOT create neurons or connect them. Other params are for monitoring and logging

Parameters:
configfilename input file (eg. "./script.txt")
ncells monitor number of cells that need to be generated
ngroups monitor number of groups
logfilename 
no_output boolean for controlling commandline output
